intro: Boechera porphyrea, commonly known as the purple rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This perennial herb typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. Its distinctive feature is its clusters of small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has dark green, elongated leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
